3. City Council

# City Council

## Responsibilities

Fort Lupton is a statutory city operating under the Colorado Revised State Statutes and Fort Lupton Municipal Code- Administrator form of government. The city council consists of the Mayor, elected at large, and six Council members, two elected from each of the city’s three wards. Generally functions as a parliamentary or congressional style legislative body proposing ordinances, holding votes and passing laws to help govern the city.

## Meeting dates and times

The City Council meetings are held on the first and third Tuesday of the month at 6:00 p.m., at City Hall, 130 South McKinley Avenue. The Council also holds Town Hall meetings on the Tuesday prior to the City Council meeting at 6:00 p.m., at City Hall, 130 South McKinley Avenue. The Town Hall meetings are for the public to have open discussion with Council regarding any topic.

## Members                                 Term Expires

- [Zo Hubbard](https://www.fortluptonco.gov/Directory.aspx?EID=13), Mayor                            11/2025
- [Valerie Blackston](https://www.fortluptonco.gov/Directory.aspx?EID=17), Ward 1                  11/2025
- [David Crespin](https://www.fortluptonco.gov/directory.aspx?EID=16), Ward 1                       11/2027
- [Chris Ceretto,](https://www.fortluptonco.gov/Directory.aspx?EID=15) Ward 2                         11/2027
- [Claud Hanes](https://www.fortluptonco.gov/Directory.aspx?EID=12), Ward 2                         11/2025
- [Michael Sanchez](https://www.fortluptonco.gov/directory.aspx?EID=183), Ward 3                   11/2025
- [Bruce Fitzgerald,](https://www.fortluptonco.gov/directory.aspx?EID=122) Ward 3                    11/2027
